intro: Hippocrepis heterocarpa, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its distinctive purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, round seed pods that mature in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
